intro: Alepidea ciliaris var. lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandbroom, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or semi-arid regions. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in dry gardens.
